column4: HELP: My Ubuntu boot-up is very slow, so i de-activated the splash screen to check where it was taking a long time, and i discovered that at the command "configuring network interfaces..." Ubuntu gets freezed up for quite some time 20-25seconds. What do i do to get this right?
i ran "sudo pppoeconf" the first time, to make sure that Ubuntu automatically connects to the net without asking me anythying everytime i start it
run network-admin and disable all of them and try reboot
But theres only one wired connection (my current ADSL) on, whats the use of disabling the only (single) and working Internet connection
try it and see what it does
i use gmail so ...but thunderbird with spamato is sweet!!!!
Yeah, i know but i can't simple send emails from my account, it comes to a notification message sarung "sending 1 message" and than that never gets completed

I want kde, but if i install kde-desktop than kde's apps show in GNOME and vice versa, but if i dont want all that clutter, i.e. if select kde, than only kde apps, and if i select GNOME only GNOME apps, is there some way to do that?
get a kubuntu cd and dual boot ubuntu and kubuntu only way i can think
